page.title: 04Education and Schools (cont)
page.content:
{Skirlaugh Church of England Primary {School }is about seventeen years old and has about 197 pupils, a headmaster, and seven teachers. Many other people help at school at dinner time, helping us cross the road and keeping the school clean. Next door is a nursery unit for children who are not yet old enough for school. It is run by a teacher and two nursery nurses.
Each class does most of its lessons with one teacher. At the end of the year the classes move on to another teacher and the oldest children move to a comprehensive school about eight miles away. The boys and girls are taken to this school by bus. Another bus brings children from the villages of Swine and Coniston to Skirlaugh School.
